summary: This document is an email chain from April 15, 2020, between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and another individual, discussing a New York Times article or daily transcript. The emails focus on obtaining and verifying a quote describing an alleged incident where Ghislaine Maxwell performed a massage on a victim, during which she exposed and massaged the victim's breasts, with Jeffrey Epstein present in the area.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient and sender of emails requesting and receiving a quote from a New York Times article or daily transcript regarding an allegation against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described in the quoted text as performing a massage on a victim, during which she exposed and massaged the victim's breasts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as being present in the area during the alleged massage performed by Ghislaine Maxwell, with the victim sensing he could see her.

persons.name: Mike Baker
persons.context: Name appears as a label preceding quoted statements in the transcript, likely indicating the speaker or source of the narrative.

connections.description: Epstein is described as being present in the area during the massage Maxwell performed on the victim, suggesting coordinated activity.
Maxwell is alleged to have performed an inappropriate massage on the victim, exposing and massaging her breasts.
The victim sensed Epstein's presence during the massage and believed he could see her, implicating him in the incident.

events.title: Alleged Inappropriate Massage by Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell performed a massage on a victim, had her lie on her back, pulled down the sheet to expose her breasts, and massaged her chest. The victim felt it was weird and uncomfortable, and sensed Jeffrey Epstein was present nearby.

keyFacts: The email chain centers on obtaining a specific quote alleging Ghislaine Maxwell performed an inappropriate massage on a victim, exposing and massaging her breasts.
The victim's account describes Maxwell as skilled in massage and repeatedly offering one, leading to the victim relenting despite never having had a professional massage before.
During the massage, the victim sensed Jeffrey Epstein was present in the open area and could see her, though he was not directly participating.
The communication shows the U.S. Attorney's office actively seeking and verifying details from media reports or transcripts related to the Maxwell/Epstein case in April 2020.
